title: Trazodone for the Treatment of Sleep Disorders in Alzheimer's Disease: a Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to determine whether trazodone is effective in the treatment of sleep disorders in Alzheimer's disease (AD).
description_detailed: Sleep disorders (SD) affects 35 to 50 percent of patients with AD. These disorders often make caring for patients at home very difficult. Trazodone is commonly prescribed drugs for SD in AD patients. There are no controlled studies in this sample of patients for this purpose.
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is trazodone, an antidepressant (serotonin antagonist and reuptake inhibitor, SARI) with sedative properties that is commonly used off-label to treat insomnia and sleep disturbance in older adults and people with dementia. The trial title and purpose state the drug is being tested for treatment of sleep disorders in Alzheimer’s disease, which is symptomatic (sleep/behavioral) management rather than targeting AD pathology (amyloid/tau). citeturn0search1turn0search0
